Update on Free Meal Options:
A letter went home about this with students today but we heard some good news since then. The state opened the application process and we will submit ours tomorrow (Thursday). Starting Friday our meals will be free for all students through December 31 or when program runs out of funds.

Important Note: This program is great, but we still need families to complete our Free-Reduced lunch forms. Once the program ends, we'll be back to the regular system. We receive between $130,000 - $150,000 in additional school compensatory aid that is based on our free-reduced lunch count. These funds help keep our class sizes small and supports paraprofessional salaries for Title I and other student assistance programs.

After meeting with the MSHSL today all AD's in the state were informed that with the new Mask guidelines put in place by the governor there will need to be some changes regarding athletic practices inside for the remainder of the summer.

The MSHSL stated that athletes will need to wear a mask if they are practicing indoors starting on Saturday 7/25, this will include when using the weight room as well. However; if exertion of the activity at any time makes it difficult for the athlete to breath while wearing the mask the athlete will be able to take the mask off. They will be asked to try and maintain social distancing of 6 feet as much as possible.

We understand how frustrating and concerning this may be, but at this time since schools are a public building we have to follow the guidelines set in place by the governor.

If you or your child are uncomfortable attending practices indoors and having to wear a mask please feel free to keep your athlete home, coaches will be ok and understanding of this decision.
